cons:
Upper management seems to lack direction.
Middle management is lost and unsure how to manage engineers. Most middle managers lack any real technical knowledge.
There is little to no opportunity to grow here because it is already too fat at the top.

pros: Fairly scrappy and agile considering we're a large company. Executive leaders are accessible to all levels of the company. Employees are loyal, creative, and driven. We're trying really hard to maintain the collaborative culture that we had when we were a small company.
cons: Lots of change at the leadership level over the past couple of years. Hopefully we'll see more stability in the near future. Our CMO left in October and they have yet to find a replacement.

review_title: Great Benefits, Fun place to work, management needs to keep up with times with regards to storage trends
job_title: Senior Member of Technical Staff in Sunnyvale, CA
pros:
Great Benefits, Open door policy!

If you are smart you will be recognized, not necessarily promoted, but recognized.
cons: Some of the senior management are clueless about the current trends in the storage industry. The company has great products from a previous generation of smart people, but are now not innovating from the front, and reflects because newer management lacks vision in certain domains

review_title: Good benefits, good Sr. Management, Good place to work.
job_title: Software Engineering Manager in Raleigh, NC
pros: The benefits are good, the stock awards are good and the commitment to creating a culture of contribution is very powerful.
cons: Middle management does not get a lot of encouragement or training.  Most middle management is home grown and not trained.  Expectations are hard to determine some time and for someone coming up from being an engineer, the transition can be uncomfortable.

job_title: Technical Writer in Research Triangle Park, NC
pros: The company culture is still young and vibrant. The sense of competition and drive to put superior products in the markeplace is felt througout the company. Employee input is valued and considered.
cons: Good management vs. bad management is about 50/50. Sometimes inexperienced or confused managers may be put in positions of authority over employees.

review_title: NetApp is quite Dubious these days.
job_title: Senior Member of Technical Staff in Bangalore
pros: Free beer served at beer bash every friday to help employees get over their dissatisfactions at the job.
cons: Although the compensation offered is okay, the roles and responsibilities are not really challenging. I have been working here for the past 5 years and worked upon a variety of projects but the skill set I built is very much restricted to NetApp. The promotions are very much time dependent and have nothing to do with performance. Besides all, the innovations being done have dropped significantly which is mostly because of the culture of the company.

review_title: Once a special place, now just another big company
pros: Great technology, great engineers - there's still a vestige of what made this company great. People really want to innovate and do the right thing.
cons: Management is overly political - they're more interested in who says what to whom than hearing the real issues. There's a lack of trust that pervades all decisions.

pros: NetApp takes being the "best place to work" seriously. Facilities and benefits in California locations and larger sites are amazing. Benefits are great. They offer some training and NetAppU is great.
cons: Very large company that is somewhat set in their ways. Certain departments not willing to change/improve. Takeover was not smooth and it was a clash of cultures. I wish we were able to work better together but that did not happen.

review_title: Great company to work for, but going through a bad time....
job_title: Member Technical Staff, Software in Bangalore
pros:
Good work culture, good work life balance. 
Good productivity tools makes the job of engineer easier.
Good facilities like free snacs, juice, soft drinks and beer bash.
Good salary, bonus and hikes.
cons:
Bad execution strategy, not so quick to react to market requirements.
Many layoffs happened in last 3 years, sometimes even twice a year. Many good employees were laid off.

pros: Exciting work environment. Many opportunities. NetApp has been growing for the past 5 years and is somewhat suffering by that growth but the culture here will prevail.
cons: Nothing that was not pointed out in the Pros above. With growth always seems to come the pervasive politics but this will pass as the inherent culture that made NetApp successful will rise.

pros: Overall was a good company. Senior Executives seemed to care about its employees and the health care benefits were excellent.
cons: Pockets of organization like IT and Marketing were pretty bad. From my frequent interaction with IT staff, the organization was a mess. CIO (Cynthia) brought her retail skills into high tech. It was not a good match and a lot of good people left

pros:
1. Opportunity to work with some of the most brilliant minds
2. Great span of technologies - Kernel, Networking, Storage, Filesystem
3. Good paymaster
cons:
1. Lot of time gets spent in coordinating cross team efforts, this diminishes the amount of time spent in getting hands-on exposure and building up individual skills and competencies
2. Very less space and focus on career growth plan for individuals. Priority given only to engineers who are vocal and visible.

job_title: Senior Web Operations Support Lead, Business Systems Analyst in Sunnyvale, CA
pros:
NetApp has many different IT projects which you can work on and make a positive impact. Managers are attentive to your needs. 
Business teams always very appreciative when IT delivers.
cons:
Too many layoffs every year (at least 3 waves per calendar year) took people morale really down. 
Majority of eliminated position are technical not managers positions.
IT Management is very arrogant in front of business teams/requirements and stands on last century approach that IT dictates rules and directions in applications design and development.

pros: Some of the greatest people I’ve ever had the privilege to work with were at NetApp.  During my time there, you could innovate and build new businesses.
cons: As growth slowed the company’s culture changed.  It has become a business model based on expense control without an investment in growth.

review_title: Excellent place to work but you must excel in a fast paced competative environment.
pros:
Great pay, great benefits package, good camaraderie, great product that customers love
With 20-30% annual growth in employees there are always new positions opening.
Fortune Magazine has ranked NetApp top place to work six years in a row coming at number 4 once.
cons: Very busy all of the time...(good and bad)

review_title: Best place I have ever worked.
job_title: Technical Support Engineer in Wichita, KS
pros: Great co-workers! There are tons of opportunities here. The company makes you feel important and goes out of the way to make you feel comfortable and enjoy coming to work. There are always activities and events to take part in.
cons: Too many things to learn. Not especially a downside, but there are a lot of products to support. You need to specialize.

review_title: I really cannot complain - that much
job_title: Support Account Manager in Morrisville, NC
pros: Depending on the job you have, there is a very relaxed culture. Work/Life balance is very important. Pay was higher than when i was asking. Great on-site benefits (beer bash, discounted on-site oil changes, discounted on-site auto detailing, free onsite gym, great cafe, social events)
cons: There are some positions that are very stressful and tend to have high turnover. This tends to make things more stressful as staffing tends to suffer due to turnover. Sr Management has acknowledged this issue and are working to fix it.

job_title: Technical Support Engineer III in Research Triangle Park, NC
pros: Lots of things like Beer Bash on Fridays, free fruit one day a week,  bagels on Friday mornings and other goodies now and then and plenty of opportunity for training.
cons: Management can be very loose allowing people to show up late 30-60 mins late day after day.  With recent happenings at NetApp you will see most of the RTP support center has been moved to other regions thanks to poor leader ship by our CEO, but he still has his job.

pros: In my experience, NetApp has given me broad strategic goals, more than adequate resources, and a great team of people to work with in order to pursue those goals.  The company is very open and collaborative, largely (but not completely, of course) free of the destructive internal politics I've seen elsewhere.
cons: Somewhat slow to market with new innovations.  Generally positive culture sometimes results in too little accountability for errors, but in general the balance is right.

pros: It was a great place to work and not sure of it anymore.  Before some management came from another company the politics was less and opportunities were good.
cons: Too much nepotism and politics and whom you know to get ahead.

pros:
There is work life balance
The compensation is above average
The exposure to storage technology is excellent
Managers are empowered
Stock options
beer - bash on fridays!!!
cons:
If you are not self motivated, there is a great chance that you will get into a comfort zone and stop growing technically.
NetApp is slow in adapting to latest tech-trends. They adopt it only if it matures enough
Finance team is slow to respond.
Leaves/Salary/etc is managed via A-Hewitt and they are dead slow with bunch of jokers responding insanely to your queries

review_title: Overall an OK place to work, but not much growth - end up with doing the same stuff for years.
pros: On the product engineering side, it is still a good place to be, if one can get to those groups.
cons: On the IT side there are constant changes in processes and not much is there for those who want to continue with technical innovation. Talent retention is becoming a problem and backfills are mostly offshore. Intergroup relations not as friendly as they used to be - not very agile either.

review_title: Definitely One of the Best Places to work for
job_title: Member of Technical Staff II in Bangalore
pros: I was hired as an NCG and Storage was a new domain for me. It was a really very nice experience learning about the industry during my initial days. They have a very good pay for NCG's and have a good learning curve in the initial days.
cons: Things seem to get monotonous after an year and half. Switching between the teams is not encouraged.

pros:
Good work-life balance.
Great transparency and appreciation for work.
You get to see the impact of your work on the company.
Great/diverse technology to learn about.
Good learning resources/engineering support (this is easy to ignore, but they prevent a lot of frustration otherwise).
cons:
Payscale wasn't at par with expectations/peer companies.
2 "imposed" shutdowns every year.
At times, too much focus on reporting and communication on managerial level.....kind of overwhelming.
Product development needs better engineers.

job_title: Member Technical Staff, Software in Sunnyvale, CA
pros: NetApp is a good company. It has great culture, and good life-work balance. The working environment is friendly, and some of the engineers even have their own offices.
cons:
It does not have any real innovations any more. 
It used to have many smart engineers working on building cool products.  Now many of those engineers left the company, and the product it delivers always behind the market.

review_title: Good place to work, focused on growth and productivity
pros: At NetApp, they encourage friendly work environment, and focus is on employ satisfaction. Great place to work, in terms of work culture and environment.
cons: It's challenging as the department I worked for went through few reorgs in the span of 2-3 years.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Wichita, KS
pros: Very good working environment, with challenging projects and good management.  They expect you to get your work done but don't freak out if something is a little late.  Many talented employees that work hard.  Good work/life balance.
cons: Would have given 5 stars if there wasn't two mandatory vacation periods for a total of ~7 days.  Employees should be able to take their vacation when they want.  Wichita employees don't get paid as well as Boulder/RTP/Sunnyvale.

pros: NetApp is a great company to work for.  Technical development is highly desirable and this platform is recommended for anyone looking to start a career in the Storage environment.
cons: There have been many employee reduction phases which have resulted in the loss of highly qualified individuals.  Such reductions have not been warranted to explain poor performing talent to remain employed while other more qualified employees have been laid off.

review_title: NetApp is a great company to work with if you have a good manager.
pros: NetApp is  a great company. It has good executives, good culture, good team work, and good benefits. It also has great growth potential.
cons: Most of the management teams are good but there are also some managers that you would wish you never had. Limited career growth opportunities, limited rotation programs.

review_title: Great place to work with top executives keen interest in prioritizing employee welfare
pros: Great people to work with, cutting edge R&D, global reach with presence in 130 countries, great flexibility in changing roles / locations
cons: Lesser breadth of technologies covered in product portfolio (when compared to large conglomerates), risk averseness in culture owing to conservative customer base

job_title: Member Technical Staff, Software in Pittsburgh, PA
pros:
This is  a small site (Pittsburgh) within the company. Great work culture compared to other larger sites.
You have to put in a lot of work to get recognized and move up the ladder.  Good work is definitely recognized.
The engineers will have the option to stay on the technical side as they grow up the ladder.
cons: A lot of process hampers engineering efforts, especially around QA. A lot of engineers working on one product slows things down (especially around code line management).

review_title: One horrible company heading in the wrong direction.
pros: Was once a growing company but is now in transition but still relatively stable.  Has a great gym and some decent benefits but nothing else.
cons: Turned into large company that doesn't provide employees any skill diversity or opportunity for growth.  Typical large company that restrict your skills to decrease marketability if you would want to leave.  Made promises they knew they wouldn't keep.

pros: They really take care of their people.  Friday beer bash is awesome!  Overall great benefits. Competitive salary. Nice facilities and work area.
cons: They force you to take two weeks (around 6-8 total days) unpaid while they do two shutdowns a year (one at christmas and one during 4th of July).  For a new employee with only 3 weeks of vacation, this is a little difficult.  Obviously 3 layoffs in the last three years doesn't help.  For my skill set: not much room to grow.

pros: Great Values, Big effort in the community and push for giving back.  The people are all nice and its an easy place to melt into.
cons: Such a large company that you often feel like you work in a silo with just your team.  Not all groups have an easy time with promoting within... Many people there who deserve to grow but the company just doesn't push it as much. (Or at least some VPs)

pros: Wonderfull environment, great people to work with . Fun place and plenty of perks. Beer on Fridays, bagels, ... employee appreciation week ... etc
cons: Strategy needs to be improved to reflect the market ups and downs. Too frequent layoffs . Top management needs to pay more attention to the longterm strategy

review_title: Excellent learning opportunities and great work culture
pros:
One of the best and open work culture, shares ideas, collaborate and innovate
Very open, you can ask any tough question to senior management
cons:
Bad designs around product strategy
TD Politics - Everything has to be on ONTAP
Sales execution needs to improve dramatically
Marketing historically was non existent, this is beginning to change

pros: Good gym, having a snack/ lounge area on every floor in every building. Pay was pretty good as an intern
cons: My team members had no idea of what they wanted me to do. I was never given enough work, they ignored me at times when I asked for more.  I honestly felt like they didn't utilize me and what I could have offered.

review_title: Dying Company in a Dying Market Segment
pros: It was fun while it lasted. NetApp "was" a fun company while it was making money. Mostly transparent management, and communication style. Flexible schedule, and work life balance.
cons: No company is fun when it's losing money. Even with it's very late entry into flash storage, NetApp is dying company in a dying market segment. The 900 lb. gorilla in the room is Amazon.com. Add to that other cloud providers such as Microsoft's Azure, Google, and software defined storage providers like RedHat, NetApp has nowhere to go but down.

job_title: Sales Development Representative in Research Triangle Park, NC
pros: Great people to work with. Managers care if you do well and go above and beyond to make you succeed. The culture and environment is great with many great employee perks.
cons: A lot of uncertanty at the company. Constant talks of major layoffs and lack of merit driven incentives leads to their top sales talent being lost to other companies.

job_title: Systems Administrator II in Durham, NC
pros: The people, the atmosphere, the little things that the company does for the employees, the benefits are great, and they are willing to work with you if you need to work from home.
cons: Recently went through a re-org where they laid off 12% of employees.  I believe that this will have a long-term positive impact.

pros: Compensation, benefits, culture are the top pros to be at NetApp.  New management in place, but unproven thus far.
cons: Negative product sales growth really puts a lot of stress into the system.  Cost cutting, RIF's every 6 months and too much turnover in the field.  Lost their mojo a bit in the market.

pros: Still some great engineers and technical experts to work with.  Some innovative products being built. A lot of learning in the trenches.
cons: Micromanagement at most levels from middle to senior management based on which team you are in. Lack of recognition esp for the people who really pull more than their weight on teams.

job_title: MTS3 in Research Triangle Park, NC
pros:
- It has an outstanding  Life/Work balance. 
- It really has a lot of perk to show the great employee appreciation culture they have.
cons:
They refuse to become a Corp.
There is a big lack of processes that are needed.
As usual, some people taking advantage of the NetApp philosophy and barely work or even go to the office.

pros: This company believes in working toward a great place to work
cons: If you get stuck with a bad boss (as in not a leader) you are screwed. Interview your employer and look into his/her background.  Determine what kind of supervisor he/she is likely to be before you take the job.

review_title: Good people is gone, great people left long time ago.
pros: It used to be a great place to work with new technology. There was a sense of doing something new and changing the ways storage was done.
cons:
No profesional selection process, middle management chosen politically not by merit. Top management disengaged from field reality. No career development or opportunities. People leaves for career development. 
Wild layoffs while company still makes money and pays dividend ¿?  Committed people fired and terrible people (but political) keeps the job.

pros:
Nice New2NetApp program.  Opportunity to learn new and relevant skills.   
Challenging yet manageable technical work.  IT, office space, comp & benefits
so much nicer than previous employer.   Encouragement to volunteer in community.
cons:
A few problematic personalities.  

Mass layoffs in the face of record revenue ($6.332 Billion for FY2013) 
and positive net income per share ($0.47 for Q4, steady year-over-year).

pros:
Great company values
Very innovative technology
Great OS that is very dependable - you can believe in the company product
the people working for NetApp are great.
cons: Few perks beyond the expected - no big parties, individual contributors always fly economy even for long haul trips, the company is always trying to save money even when they do well, no recognition for long term employees such as reaching 5 years or 10 years.

review_title: Was a great place, not anymore
pros: Best part of working with NetApp is work life balance. Fexible timings, work from home option and average workload are few things people are happy about. Work profile might be good if you are in correct BU.
cons: Company is lacking vision. Project gets cancelled frequently. Compensation used to be good but now it is just average in the industry. Career progress is very slow and promotions are really tough nowadays. US couterpart has always an upper hand over Indians.

job_title: Member of Technical Staff IV in Bangalore
pros: This is my second company and this is my 9th year in this company.Apart from excellent benifts the amount of opportunities and the amount of flexiblity provied for the employess is simply amazing.Employees are encouraged to innovate and every idea is acknolowded. We need not wait for year end to wait for recogniotions, as there are ample recoginition programs periosically to  motivate the employess all year around.. 360 degree feedbacks are considered seriously and apporpriate actions are taken..
cons: So far I have not faced anydownsides.

job_title: TSE3 in Research Triangle Park, NC
pros:
- company has some fun perks- food and the beer bash. 
- nice campus, gym onsite
cons:
unstable times for the industry.  company has faltered with hardware sales and has had frequent changes in direction in short time.  hopefully, on the up.
- recently let go a lot of experience in the product support group

review_title: Once a great company, now a shell
pros: Excellent products overall, competent and passionate employees, management commitment. As "great place to work" finalist many years running and the culture reflects that.
cons: Unfortunately, 4 years of stagnant growth, along with poor management and technical decisions have eroded much of the product leadership and employee (and customer) goodwill.

pros: Lots of smart, hardworking people at NetApp. Collaboration between different offices in different locations was very easy. Managers were personable and cared about the employees. Employees were always willing to help other employees. Intern program taught us some general information about the business which was interesting
cons: Lots of time spent waiting to talk to people like managers. I worked there during a transition period between CEO's which caused there to be a lot of extra meetings. Changes in security measures impacted productivity for a few weeks.

job_title: QA Team Leader in Belmont, CA
pros: Great Campus in Sunnyvale with lots of amenities.  Offices or cubes versus open floor plan.  Company cares about its employees.   Good cross collaboration in engineering teams.
cons: Low Growth Business.  Cloud Computing makes use of cheap disk drives.  NetApp charges a premium for its disk drives.   Engineering has become an Indian dominated culture.

job_title: Product Manager in Research Triangle Park, NC
pros: Overall a good culture and decent pay and perks. Not a "slave driver" mentality. Friday Beer-Bash is a great way to end the week. Facilities are very good.
cons: 401k match is poor. Upper management is very weak. Processes and tools are fairly weak. Lots of re-orgs and lay-offs.

pros: Very good culture and good product. This company is really good for it culture and going beyond nature. They do contribute to local communities through Volunteer program. Their product are top notch. I liked working here a lot.
cons: Recently the financial headwind due to change in market is significant. NetApp is trying hard and they will find a way to move forward but last few years have been very difficult in this environment.

job_title: TSE II in Research Triangle Park, NC
pros: Was a comfortable place to work.  Camaraderie was great, people worked together.  Good perks and benefits.
cons: I started in 2014 by which time 2 major layoffs had already happened.  Sign of things to come.  Too many Chefs in the kitchen and too many tools/products that should have been rolled together long ago.  NetApp was too enamored with their flagship, DataONTAP 7-mode for too long.  Too many middle and upper management having too many meetings to justify their jobs.  Now they are going from 1 layoff/year to 2.   Stay away till things stabilize, they are bought or they simply sink into the black hole of penny stocks.

pros: Folks are generally friendly. If leadership can turn the ship around, I do believe NetApp has great potential to revive. Great work/life balance.
cons: What was once an energetic and passion-filled company has turned for the worse. Unfortunately, the company still has a lot of catching up to do. Coupled with the annual layoffs, many employees are looking to move. Unfortunately, a lot of folks left are those who have "settled" with NetApp (for whatever reason - family, job stability, income stability, good work/life balance, visa).

pros: NetApp prides itself on being a great place to work, and in some ways it is.  In particular, there is a real effort coming from the top to have managers who treat their subordinates respectfully and as partners rather than as slaves who need to toe the line or else.
cons: NetApp has gotten itself into a regular cycle of layoffs that has been going on so long that one questions whether the company has a future.

pros: Culture, culture, culture.  The best company culture I've experienced over a 20 year career thus far.  Everyone from field sales to product engineering was willing and able to work together to help customers succeed.
cons: There are always bad apples to contend with and I certainly ran across a few at NetApp.  Those folks stand out in a bad way pretty quickly and the company was sometimes a bit slow to deal with the problem.

pros: Well established enterprise company. Lots of freedom to drive personal results. The company is in the middle of its own transformation which creates a lot of opportunities.
cons: The company culture was great until the transformation started. There's a strong focus on the direction of the company, but middle management struggles to adopt the new mantra. Many good people left the company and many looking for an opportunity outside of the company due to the 'old-boys' network-of-favoritism.

review_title: NetApp is a great place to work... seriously!
pros:
Great work/life balance
Great development opportunities 
Senior Management - open, communicative etc 
Fairly compensated for job and locations
cons: Give "Managers" the opportunity to manage if they are interested as development opportunity

pros: The people at NetApp are outstanding.  If an employee or customer needs help there is always someone ready.
cons: The work life balance is a little off at time but management is trying to address this topic.  Recently the marketing has gotten ahead of some of the product capability. The company grew very fast and part of what motivated employees was the stock price and upward mobility with these absent many good people are leaving.

review_title: Good job but way too busy and understaffed
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Research Triangle Park, NC
pros: Great environment, lot's of learning potential if you want it. Seriously, you just need to ask. Beer and barfood Friday was a definite plus to network with other departments.
cons: The big one, TSE's are WAY understaffed. TSE1 are just ticket openers. TSE2 first line of defense and abused. TSE3 and EE is where you want to be.

pros:
1) Stable job
2) Good quality of life because the work is not very difficult
cons:
1) Very low prospects of growth. Expect a promotion in 5+ years, and there are so many layers that if you start as a Software Engineer, you'll become a Senior Engineer in 12+ years (if you're lucky).
2) Salary and compensation is significantly lower than many other companies in the Bay Area.
3) Your manager (middle management) is going to be your biggest hurdle to growth.

review_title: Excellent, great company. Good people, great culture
pros: Definitely a good place to work for, very open culture and good opportunities for growth
cons:
- Palpable difference between culture at Sunnyvale and Bangalore. Bangalore is a little more political and not as open as the Sunnyvale HQ
- Need to attract more top young talent (from top universities). Need to increase compensation to retain talent

review_title: Good company, great work life balance, but big company processes getting in the way.
pros:
Innovative technology 
Great work life balance
Strong people, they're knowledgeable, willing to help
cons:
Career opportunities non existent
Silos preventing communication and information sharing
Top-down communication can be better, sometimes feel isolated

review_title: Still a great company to work for, but was better
pros: Good pay, great people, freedom to "get the job done" your way, ability to work from home, great products
cons: Company is getting bigger and culture is suffering a bit.  Still better than any company I have worked for, but there has been a definite change in the past 4-5 years.

pros:
Absolutely fun place to work. 
The culture allows for hard work, performance and matching rewards. 
Ethics and values are core and people are respected for who they are.
It is like a global village, a melting pot for humanity and an opportunity to work with awesome colleagues and mentors :)
cons: Business limited due by the limited product line offerings for the Indian market

pros: The company culture is the highlight of working for NetApp. Though some of the recent layoffs have been tough, they do treat there employees well.
cons: Unfortunately the company hasn't been selling much of the Clustered Ontap products. The stock price has been on a downward trend.

pros: NetApp has great technology, is loved by their customers, and offers employees an excellent opportunity to create work life balance and to determine their career future.
cons: Behind the curve on market acceptance of their technology but improving in this area rapidly.  Tough competitive environment eating away at market position and employee retention.

job_title: Member Of Technical Staff in Bangalore
pros: If you're a person who likes to play politics you will flourish here.
cons:
> Less than industry standard pay
> High attrition, everyone here is using NetApp as a springboard to something else
> Politics, there are managers and senior employees who do no work and take all the credit leaving the people who do the actual work very frustrated
> Layoffs are a topic of discussion everyday leaving the entire workforce disgruntled
> No recognition given to people who perform well
> Manager starts taking all the credit for the engineers work, engineering oriented culture my foot
> Definitely not a great place to work
> Strategy and org changes every 6 months leaving the engineers in disarray

pros:
Great Company, Great culture, challenging work. Customer focus is intense. 
Great Company, Great culture, challenging work. Customer focus is intense.
cons: Highly competitive industry in just about every location where NetApp has offices. People never leave because of culture they are leaving to join start-ups who play in the storage or cloud spaces. The past few quarters have taken their toll on salary increases and that has been a dissatisfier for lot of people.

review_title: Great company but struggled to catch up storage market shift
pros:
Overall a great company, very employee friendly, good benefits and pay package.
Since past 2 years company has struggled to catch up with storage market shift from traditional disc based product to Cloud based storage. This has resulted in revenue decline and cost cutting.  Given the current situation, this may not be a perfect time to join. I would advise folks to wait for NetApp to be back on growth chart.
cons:
Revenue declining YoY.
Currently undergoing cost cutting.

pros: Excellent product mix. Great focus on the long term strategies necessary to move into a software centric Cloud Strategy. Excellent field leadership coupled with equally committed people. Burdgeoning partner relationships that will have a great long term benefit.
cons: The "customer experience" has suffered as a result of a bottom line focus rather than a focus on the solution-sell itself. Field facing technical resources are scarce and over worked. Sales and Systems Engineering roles have enormous turnover.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Research Triangle Park, NC
pros: Flexible work hours, great work culture, free access to fitness center with lots of training/classes, pool tables, ping-pong, foosball, annual picnics, outings, 40 hours of volunteering time, etc and did I say Beer on fridays?
cons: Poor Management - mostly at the executive level and a unfriendly/un-supportive HR and poor outsourcing decisions in recent years

pros: Work life balance, felxible timings, good insurance policies for spouse and kids, employes are asked for managers feedback and in most cases the management does take the feedbacks seriuosly.
cons: No clear plans for where the company needs to be, bad decisions made in the past has affected the company growth, off late the management is no serious about attriions they have created an uncertainity environment which has made good engineers quit. Old timers are taken for a ride in terms of merit hike, but the new joinees get good benefits.

pros:
NetApp has a core of strong storage systems software engineers that are hard-working and innovative.

NetApp has a multi-decade history of delivering compelling storage technology. Very few companies can boast such a successful path.
cons: NetApp faces some financial headwinds, and it can be frustrating to face difficult decisions under pressure from forces that push a short-term focus instead of a "built-to-last" perspective.

review_title: LayApp-Good Workplace as long as you have your job
pros:
Great Workplace (as long as you have your job)
Great Pay
Competitive
Good managers but there the odd bad ones.
cons:
Best known as LayApp
You might be good with your work and might have the skills to do your job better than others but that is not going to save you when its time to layoff. 
The constant shake up leaves deep scars on affected and unaffected teams . Hardly surprising that some layoffs in the past have affected their delivery of products and services

review_title: Fast-Paced, Best-of-Breed environment, innovation within slowing down.  Outsourcing big strategy
pros: High caliber colleagues.  Lots of opportunity to do interesting work.  Flexiblity.
cons: Crunch mode continues year after year after year.  Sr mgmt still thinking in silos. Cross functional focus becoming increasingly more critical to success, lack internal know-how and will to execute.

review_title: One good person once said "stop the bozo invasion". Sry its happened and its to late

cons: If you want something done then ask a busy man, this happens all the time whilst others sit by and do nothing. People are more interested in building an empire within the company than doing right by the company, and its getting worse.

pros: Friendly, flexible, oriented towards future growth, opportunity and change. NetApp is an easy place to call home and I enjoy the variety of options provided for my growing interests in the marketing space.
cons: Due to highly collaborative environment, it can sometimes be a challenge to move projects forward quickly. Some teams are more flexible than others when it comes to things like work from home or flex hours.

review_title: Great till mediocre management started to take over.

review_title: Worst company I have worked in my entire professional life (more than 25 years)
pros: Could not think of any
cons:
Of my 1.5 years at NetApp as an engineering manager. I spend close to 50% of my time working on a stupid spread sheet for bug forecasting; a week by week forecast of up to 16 weeks or more of how many bugs you will have each week. They call this an art of "voodoo" themselves. Yet the senior management will come down on you so fast and merciless if you exhibited any signs of unwillingness in doing it. "We have been doing this for years and years" is what they will say to you and that itself is enough reason to justify why they are doing it still so it seems.
If you went above your forecast, they want you to figure out why and where these bugs came from. If you went below your forecast, they want you to know if you padded your numbers and perhaps you should re-work your numbers re-forecast so you are not constantly below.

They seem to think making you spending all your time on bug forecast will help with their product quality, of which there are certainly many escalations exist including bringing down Apple's iTunes down frequently.

It seems all the good people who can think independently and cares about what they do have left the company and the ones who can not, got promoted to be manager/senior managers. Of cause there are exceptions. 

Bonus and merits are good means for managers to retain talents. Here it is abused to play favoritism.    I have seen my manager withholding both to drive away a key talent in the team on a mission critical project. When I tried to put in a significant merit increase in a desperate try to keep the employee around, I was told I should never have done that without discussing this first and given that it is my first time, he'll forgive me for doing it. I, as the direct manager, seems to have no right to even make recommendations.

The senior manager of the team absolutely does not care how critical you are to the project at hand and/or NetApp, we had 9 people resign from his team in the past 2 years of a team sized ~20, a ~40% turn over rate which is so alarmingly high that it will certainly raise eye brows anywhere else in the industry. But it has not here. 

There seem to be no accountability. As the product the senior manager delivered last caused numerous field escalations including the problems stated at Apple. The issues was not narrowed down/sort of patched up till ~20 engineers-year later. This has starved all other developments in the team. Because he knows no strategy except a "pile-up" one which he is quite proud of.

He is still there, driving away talents and delivering products with questionable quality, and god forbidden, might be on his way to be the next director. It is pretty scary to think how long the company will last having this kind of people in charge of the most critical part of NetApp's product.

pros: Opportunity to work with lots of smart people, lot of appreciation for driving initiative. Opportunity to take up different career path, grow with a fast growing company.

cons: Very long hours.  Lots of stress.  No work/life balance.  No promotion from within.  Should spend more time making it a great place to work instead of on all of the marketing of this goal.  Not a diverse product portfolio.

pros: Beer bash, work environment, occasional free lunch. Data ONTAP has potential, I suppose, but it's way behind the competition and is playing catchup.
cons: The Waltham office is a satellite to the HQ in Sunnyvale and has always been treated as such - insignificant. Lots of incompetent middle management promoted from within. 4 VPs in less than 2 years?! Monthly attrition at a great place to work?!

job_title: Member Of Technical Staff in Bangalore
pros: I am working in netapp for more than 5 years. This is an ideal place to work for with lots of opputunities and new learning. It has great culture and you will one has the full responsibility of his/her job and freedom of doing his own way.
cons: I have not found as such, but now a days they are cutting some of the benefits of the employees which they were providing early.

review_title: I have a great learning at NetApp. great opportunities to explore, proud to be a netappian
pros: Great culture, Open communication, great engineering teams
cons: very rigid in adopting new technologies and growing business

pros:
Great culture, coworkers, environment.

I actually like coming to work and interacting with my coworkers. I have a great boss and I feel like she takes what I have to say seriously and will seek my advice.  I don't feel like there's a huge hierarchy here.
cons: Sometimes leadership needs to work on having more clarity about the company's direction.  They say they are being clear and tell us things, but it's all super high level.

review_title: Good place to work but not for long time
pros:
Work culture here is great. People are good and make awesome colleagues. 
work life balance is great.  Not a lot of micro management.
cons: Middle management is clueless. There is a lot of fat in the management and lot of high officials who don't have big charters. They keep changing strategies all the time.

review_title: Small Company w/ Large Company Management Culture
pros: Pay is very competitive, benefits are excellent, location is central to communities near Raleigh, Durham, Chapel Hill, Cary, Apex
cons: Weird calendar and meeting focused culture. If it's not on the calendar then it's not important.  Seems like employees think they are measured by how full their outlook calendars are?

review_title: Earned It's Great Place To Work ratings.
pros: Built on a great culture; excellent benefits; competitive pay. Products were solid and the customers loved them.
cons: At the time of my layoff, the company made a huge, structural shift that changed the culture and "DNA" of the company. They brought in large numbers of people from other companies who had no appreciation for the history and culture of the company.

pros: I have worked here for about five years. I love everything about this company: benefits are great (for example, you get 4 different time offs: sick leave, vacation, volunteer time off and holidays), salary is very competitive, workplace is fantastic
cons: The disadvantage for me is the business domain itself. It is a storage company and your experience will be limited to storage software/hardware

job_title: Senior Program Manager in Sunnyvale, CA
pros:
• Competitive salary
• Pretty good work-life balance
cons:
• Constant re-structurings - employees shoulder the burden for mistakes made by the Executive Management Team; the 'let's see what sticks' approach is very disruptive
• Dog-eat-dog environment; management seems to pit people against one another
• HR is useless if an employee needs help with a negative work environment
• Lack of respect for marketing employees and programs

pros: Talented people, great training, knowledgeable staff, great work ethics, lots of food.
cons: Lack of corporate direction. Company seems to be going through a change and just hanging on. It's not the company it used to be. After years of trying to get on with this company I just missed the timing working there being let go within a short time due to cut backs.

review_title: Will the glorious past ensure a secure future?
pros:
Great work culture
Very helpful colleagues
Employee-friendly workplace
cons:
- Resorted to downsizing as a means for covering up what clearly was a mistake by the top management in not understanding the changing market trends. Flash was a train they almost missed. Hyperconvergence is another one that they might miss if they do not wake up very soon.
- The regular downsizing efforts of the last few years have resulted in the company losing out on many talented people.

pros: They seem to have resurrected the business plan they're doing okay in a very competitive space. The only thing that matters is the bottom line. Great cafe good healthy food.
cons: No RSUs offered unless your a Sr. level management, benefits are run of the mill. The company culture is, well, pardon the term it's a senior citizen center. Diversity is not well balanced including too many contractors. Weekly one on ones are ridiculous, which include systemic micro management. Did I mention culture is in need of improvement. Some management are not subject matter experts.

pros:
* Ability to identify what you want to work on and have freedom to deliver. 
* Startup type culture although we are a 10,000+ company. 
* Very flexible
* Usually working on bleeding edge technologies.
cons:
* Very product operations driven company
* Not very process oriented - leads to split brain functioning once in a while
* Has hiring freezes once too often.

review_title:
Really one of the best place to work for.
I have been working with NetApp for more than 4 years.
job_title: Member Of Technical Staff in Bangalore
pros:
Great work culture with better work life balance.
Good technology to work on.
Get enough flexibility and free mind to work on a given feature.
cons:
Not hire a right talent sometime.
Lot of politics in middle management. In some teams, more often you find people doing politics than actual work.
Very tolerant for under performers.

job_title: Technical Support Engineer in Research Triangle Park, NC
pros: It's hard to find any, most of the good people have already left.  Attrition is out of control.  Run away if you can
cons: Constant change as new leaders are brought on board.  Then the new leaders figure out its a losing game and yet another new leader is brought on board.  No real interest in employee development.  Its all about making the quarterly numbers (which hasn't happened in a while).  New CEO who built the product that no one wants, not sure how he's going to fix anything

pros: Flexibility to work from home, but it is up to each manager.  Good salary.  Great benefits.  Good gym.
cons: Lack of direction from upper management.  Fire drills galore.  You can be doing 90% of your job great but it is the 10% that you are not addressing that they will look at.

pros: Good company culture, good work life balance. People are very very smart and willing to help. Fun after work activities for university grad hires.
cons: The company lacks vision. There seems to be a lot of complaining. Not many people are willing to step up to make a change although they claim the company is 'transforming'.

review_title: Great place, fast growing and too successful going the same direction as others who got acquired or merged.
pros: Still a place with a strong team and a positive culture. People are open and helpful. Strong customer and partner base.
cons: Lost product leadership, no clear future vision. Too much focus on internal process and slow decision/change management.

pros: Great culture & environment to work, initiative to work and carry out projects, top level management is great, great clarity and communication between senior managements and employees, employee friendly and great place to work at.
cons: Support is rotational shift and often hampers work-life balance, Mid level managers have issues of  favouritism, line of work progress is sometimes ambiguous, strictly process oriented and hampers self initiative and new ideas sometimes.

pros: CEO knows what to do. We are in the worlds of facebook, amazon, twitter and its all about data and NetApp seems to be catching up with things in the last 2-3 years
cons: Various departments can get a bit organized. They should train all departments with product features. Some employees who arent in the Product dept, dont know NetApp products.

pros: great environment, flexible working hours and can telecommute. Salary and benefits are competitive. Have attractive perks.
cons: Most of the people working there are software engineers. May feel alone if you come in as there roles such as project managers, finance, quality, etc.

review_title: Can't meet expectations then lower them
job_title: Technical Support Engineer in Raleigh, NC
pros: If your into challenges and lot's of hard work it's a great place to be. There are perks if you have the time for them.
cons: Far too little is done to manage workload. Lots of training is offered within however most of it is rather lack luster.

pros: NetApp has a focus of  including employees in important decisions and caring for employees  - 5 paid days of volunteer time off, stock option exchange program, no salary cuts during the downturn.  Employees at all levels are included in determining the business strategy and go forward planning.
cons: I can't think of any!

review_title: Company is very collaborative, with minimal politics.
pros: Very people oriented culture that is strongly supported by management. Company recognizes the need to change as it grows, and is quite committed to developing the needed processes, tools, and infrastructure. Management views the big picture, and is willing to tackle big problems.
cons: Company does not have corporate wide product planning methodology or tools. Planning mechanisms are mostly ad hoc, on a group by group basis.

job_title: Senior Engineering Manager in Sunnyvale, CA
pros: NetApp was a great place to work. The senior leaders cared as much about the culture and the employees as they did about the bottom line.  They made the team feel important.  The facilities and resources were great.
cons: Middle management got bogged down and had issues making decisions and tradeoffs.  They became risk averse as well.  Inefficient processes were also deployed.

job_title: Professional Services Consultant in Sunnyvale, CA
pros: Flex time, great campus, great benefits, and employees are respected and valued.  The Professional Services / Sales organization is challenging and has many opportunities for growth.
cons: after hours and weekend work at times due to my customer's schedules.  The Professional Services positions can be stressful at times and have a lot of travel depending on the time of year.

pros: Amazing things to work with, if you're in the right divisions. Very helpful people, and technical excellence is usually rewarded. Most orgs are thankfully not very political (QA is one of the worst in this aspect).
cons: Bad managers can really make your life miserable - and there are plenty of them. I've seen plenty of useless engineers get promoted, and good ones ruined as well. Things aren't consistent across the company.

review_title: Good business model, but touch to work there for a lot of BUs
pros: Above average salaries, extra time off for volunteer work, a lot of exciting projects to work on.
cons: Be prepare for long working hours (15+ a day) with lots of unproductive meetings.  The equally shared development between US and India strategy created enormous overheads.  Management turn over rate is very high (100% in a 5 yrs).  You have to play the game in order to suvive.

job_title: Operations Program Manager in Sunnyvale, CA
pros: They have a great culture of innovation, teamwork, collaboration, and accessible executives. The Sunnyvale campus is very nice, with cafes and a great fitness center with many wellness programs. Very conscientious of being good to the community and environment.
cons: Sometimes can be a little too collaborative. Depending on your organization, I would say most people don't have the option to telecommute regularly.

review_title: Tough if you aren't a SW developer
pros: Profitable company with good benefits and positive customer-focused culture that encourages positive action. Strong employees; challenging employees have been winnowed out by multiple RIFs.
cons: Hard to advance if you aren't in a favored part of the company. Performance review system skews rewards towards small number of employees repeatedly. Limited horizontal movement.

review_title: Too Much Power In Incompetant Hands
pros: Great employee benefits, and the company is socially conscious contributing to Habitat for Humanity and donating employee time to non profit activity.
cons: Global goals with no global execution.  The company markets to the world as if everyone lived in  the United States.

job_title: Technical Support Engineer in Research Triangle Park, NC
pros: Excellent pay and benefits with a relatively good work/life balance.
cons: Middle, upper, and executive management have lost touch with what the average day-to-day employee experience and make judgement calls based on money alone.

review_title: Not a good place to work anymore..
pros: Some teams might be good to work in depending on the product & team.
cons:
Layoff every year from past 3-4 years.  Declining revenue. Lot of politics and frequent re-orgs. Unless you are part of a clique, you won't get very far.

 I don't know how they manage to be on the great places to work list.

pros:
Great engineers who like to solve a problem
Open communication from management that fosters positive culture
Recognize mistakes and learn from it to evolve
cons:
Stock price has been range bound for many years, so not growing over long term
Workforce has been shrinking through reductions that may give uncertainty to team

job_title: Storage Network Engineer in McKinney, TX
pros:
Its a good product but there is no new innovation. 
Sunnyvale FAS side is much better and multicultured.
cons:
They run E-Series as a family own business from Wichita office. Micromanagement and grouping. 
 If you from WSU and start their as contractor then u will survive. Do not ruin your career moving to Wichita. They only need Test Jockeys.
